cs671

Interface Guesser<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of secrets
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HiLo, Liar

    public interface Guesser<T>
    A "guesser" interface. A guesser is an object that produces a series YES/NO questions and, based on replies to these questions, eventually produces an answer to a secret finding problem. The interface is generic: type T represents the type of secrets produced. A guesser object is used by repeatedly calling makeQuestion to produce a question and yes or no to respond to the question, until hasSolved returns true. Before this interaction starts, the guesser must be initialized using method initialize. All other methods throw IllegalStateException if the guesser is not initialized.
    Version:
    2.3, 01/22/13
    Author:
    Michel Charpentier
    See Also:
    HiLo, Liar

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T getSecret()
      The answer to the problem.
      boolean hasSolved()
      Whether the problem has been solved.
      String initialize()
      Initializes the guessing engine.
      String makeQuestion()
      Generates a new question.
      void no()
      Used to reply NO to the previous question.
      double progress()
      Indicates progress towards solving the problem.
      void yes()
      Used to reply YES to the previous question.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        String initialize()
        Initializes the guessing engine. This method must be called to initiate a problem before the rounds of questions and answers begin.
        Returns:
        An initialization message that can be displayed to the user

      • hasSolved

        boolean hasSolved()
        Whether the problem has been solved. While this method returns false, users should continue to call methods makeQuestion, yes and no. Once it returns true, the method getSecret can safely be called.
        Returns:
        true iff the problem has been solved
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the engine has not been initialized
        See Also:
        makeQuestion(), yes(), no(), getSecret()

      • getSecret

        T getSecret()
        The answer to the problem. This method should be called after hasSolved returns true to retreive the solution to the problem.
        Returns:
        the answer to the problem, if it is known
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the problem has not yet been solved or the guesser has not been initialized
        See Also:
        hasSolved()

      • yes

        void yes()
        Used to reply YES to the previous question. Method makeQuestion must be called to generate a question before calling yes or no.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if makeQuestion has not been called first or the guesser has not been initialized
        See Also:
        makeQuestion(), no()

      • no

        void no()
        Used to reply NO to the previous question. Method makeQuestion must be called to generate a question before calling yes or no.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if makeQuestion has not been called first or the guesser has not been initialized
        See Also:
        makeQuestion(), yes()

      • makeQuestion

        String makeQuestion()
        Generates a new question. The previous question must be answered (using yes or no) before a new question is generated.
        Returns:
        the question, as a string to be displayed to the user
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the guesser is not initialized, the problem is already solved or the previous question has not been answered
        See Also:
        initialize(), hasSolved(), yes(), no()

      • progress

        double progress()
        Indicates progress towards solving the problem. After initialization, the value returned is 0 (unless the problem is immediately solved, in which case it is 1). It always increases as the guessing process progresses. It is exactly 1 after the problem is solved.
        Returns:
        a value between 0 and 1 that is a measure of how much progress has been made towards solving the problem
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the engine has not been initialized
